commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed the project to "Dongji", which means a friend in Korean, and changed all reference to Duke correspondingly
commitResults.messageBody: Added exit message, and separated greeting and exit message to separate function

commitResults.messageTitle: Added echo feature to echo the user input
commitResults.messageBody: Created class declaration Dongji and moved all chatbot functionalities to object level declaration

commitResults.messageTitle: Added 'add task' feature and 'list task' feature as new functions
Encapsulated task as new Task class, and defined its behaviors
Added 3 types of new Tasks (Event, Todo, Deadline) as subclass of Task, and muted Tasks as abstract.
commitResults.messageBody: Implemented corresponding toString behaviors according to property of each type.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented error-handling using Exceptions.
commitResults.messageBody: Created custom exceptions to handle exceptions encountered in Dongji project

commitResults.messageTitle: Added 'delete' feature
commitResults.messageBody: Added new exception that handles deleting, marking, and unmarking invalid task index.

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolved compilation error in previous version
Created static factory of each task type and moved all object generation logic to each respective task type's class.
Added semi-automated testing using shell script
Refactored Dongji class by creating TaskList and encapsulating list related operations into TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody: Changed to use default runtest.sh provided from scaffold code given.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor the code to use higher level of OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Classes in the project, especially the Dongji class, are undertaking several roles and "reasons to change" thus going against Single Responsibility Principle.

The design has low scalability and will make feature addition and future changes difficult.

Introduce new component 'Parser' to undertake parsing of the string command and generate corresponding Command instance. Introduce the Command interface and its implementations to represent Command internally, thus take advantage of polymorphism. Introduce Ui component which undertakes displaying of informations.

Dividing the role of Dongji to only undertake the entrance point role will improve scalabilitty and maintainability by dividing the high level logic (Command, Task) and low level logic (Ui) in separate component. This will also make the code in Dongji class more simple and legible as well.

Let's,
* Separate display logic into Ui component
* Separate parsing logic into Parser component
* Separate command specific execution details into Command interface and its implementations

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new feature: Saving of working tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
When the application terminates, all the task data user is working on gets deleted because the application didn't have persistence layer.

For flawless user experience, the task should be able to persist even after the application terminates, so that when user comes back they can continue working on their tasks.

Add interface Persistence that defines how persistence layer should behave, and an implentation Txt that defines logics to save onto .txt file format.

Programming on interface Persistence will enable future addition of saving on other file formats, which grant additional scalability and flexibility. Adding Txt implementation will grant basic savings functionality based on Persistence interface without losing significant feature at the moment.

Let's add Saving feature by adding Persistence interface and its implementation Txt.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use LocalDateTime instead of String for deadlines and events
commitResults.messageBody:
The deadline and event classes are using Strings instead of formal date/time types.

This could be misleading because anything can go into date/time field, which does not make sense in common use cases.

Replace all occurrences of String dates into DateTimeData, which is a wrapper around LocalDateTime with options to whether it would contain time as well.

Using formal DateTime instead of String for dates would prevent users inputting invalid values in date field. Additionally, using a wrapper DateTimeData would allow users flexibility to choose whether to use time together with date or not.

Let's replace String date formats to DateTimeData to grant date format safety and users' flexibility.

commitResults.messageTitle: EventCommand: prevent event's end date being earlier than start date
commitResults.messageBody:
The EventCommand allows the user to input end date earlier than start date, which does not make sense and goes against normal use case.

Add check to prevent event's end date being earlier than start date

By adding a check, we can prevent user adding an event with wrong timeframe by mistake (e.g. typo).

Let's check the validity of start and end date of event by adding a check.

commitResults.messageTitle: Package the application into Dongji package
commitResults.messageBody:
The application was in default directory, and not packaged.

Create new package Dongji and move the entire project into it.

Let's move the application into valid package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merged gradle support branch
Add test for ListCommand class and Event class
Modify build.gradle vscode's settings.json to build the JAR using gradle
Add Javadoc comments to public methods
Add Feature: Find task by keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Dongji does not support find task by keyword.

When task list gets exhaustive and the user cannot see all tasks at once, find by keyword is necessary, but Dongji doesn't know how to do it.

Add Find task by keyword, by creating FindCommand and implementing finding logics within. Add 'find' command parsing to CommandParser so that it can understand find command.

A new component FindCommand is necessary to represent new type of Command. Then, update Parser so that it can  identify "find" from the user input.

Let's add FindCommand and modify CommandParser to enable 'find by keyword' feature

commitResults.messageTitle: Add checkstyle to check Java code against 2103T coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no explicit tool to check coding style and keep it under control.

This could lead to mistaken coding style that does not obey the coding standards set by the teaching team.

Adding checkstyle plugin to the project to take advantage of static analysis.

Let's add checkstyle to the project, to prevent the code becoming a spaghetti, with the help of static analysis.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add GUI on the application using JavaFX
commitResults.messageBody:
The application support text-based interaction with the user.

This could be difficult for normal users without much affinity to keyboard to use the application, thus decreasing generality of application.

Adding GUI to the application using JavaFX.

The implementation of GUI is not perfect yet, as the implementation only echoes the user input.

Let's add basic GUI setup to the project to lay foundation for further development of GUI on the project.

commitResults.messageTitle: Connect Dongji backend with JavaFx frontend
commitResults.messageBody:
The application only can echo the command entered by the user.

This does not match the specification for application, which is an interactive todo list.

Connecting Dongji backend with JavaFx Frontend by extracting previously frontend specific behaviors from Dongji class into CommandLine class, and isolating it as fully backend component, not having to know about frontend logics. Creating new Main class to act as launcher to launch either CommandLine application, or GUI application.

The GUI is now responding with same text as CommandLine interface. This lowers the barrier of using the application.

The modified design improves design of the application because the high-level component (Dongji) doesn't know anything about low-level component, thus cleaning up the wrong dependency directions. This will allow greater flexibility in the application.

Let's complete GUI implementation by connecting Dongji backend and JavaFx frontend, and cleaning up dependency directions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revise the Code to obey Coding Standard as suggested by peer reviews
Revise the code to obey Coding Standard as suggested by peer review
